meanings.definition: To lure or entice someone with the promise of communist or socialist beliefs.
meanings.sent1: The politician tried to redbait the voters by promising socialist reforms.
meanings.sent2: She often uses her platform to redbait young students into joining her political group.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that the only way to get him to a party was to redbait him with free food.
meanings.sent4: Her persuasive arguments redbaited even the most skeptical listeners into considering socialist ideas.
meanings.sent5: The colorful banners and catchy slogans were the perfect redbait to attract new members to the socialist club.

meanings.definition: A person who lures or entices others with communist or socialist beliefs.
meanings.sent1: The redbait was known for his ability to convince others of the benefits of communism.
meanings.sent2: She was labeled a redbait after successfully recruiting several members to the socialist cause.
meanings.sent3: The redbait always had a way of making even the most serious topics sound exciting.
meanings.sent4: In the political arena, he was a master redbait, drawing in supporters with his charisma.
meanings.sent5: The young activist was a natural redbait, effortlessly inspiring others to consider socialist ideals.
